poem:
**Shilajit Surge**

In the scroll of virile dreams,  
algorithms weave a tale—  
bittersweet whispers  
of stones and mountains,  
testosterone swells like rivers.  
Yet, fissures of bias  
crack the screen,  
casting shadows  
where bodies echo.  
Men, in binary dance,  
seek the untamed,  
while reason's pulse  
beats softly beneath.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Shilajit: male influencers claim it boosts testosterone and libido, but what does the science say? | Antiviral Gender biases embedded in the way social media algorithms serve us content are well documented: algorithms have been found to amplify misogynistic content and unduly objectify women’s bodies, and are often cited as a driver of political polarisation between young men and women. If you are online and of the male persuasion, you are more likely than me". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Shilajit: male influencers claim it boosts testosterone and libido, but what does the science say? | Antiviral Gender biases embedded in the way social media algorithms serve us content are well documented: algorithms have been found to amplify misogynistic content and unduly objectify women’s bodies, and are often cited as a driver of political polarisation between young men and women. If you are online and of the male persuasion, you are more likely than me
